episode_title: He Built a $200K Newsletter. Then launched a $100K Christmas Lights Biz with Jas Singh
transcript:
ï»¿Nikolas Hulewsky (00:00.91)
Jazz, you were my first second time guest. You are now my first third time guest and I'm stoked to have you. So Jazz built or Jazz called me. We had a conversation over a year ago. You're one of my first conversations when I started podcasting. Then you launched a local newsletter. That local newsletter now has 106,000 subscribers. You're doing between 10 and $15,000 a month in revenue just on that newsletter. So you built a great business. Episode 105, it's one of my most listened to episodes with you.


In fact, it's the episode that plays on my YouTube page. So go listen to it. It's a freaking great episode where jazz goes through the economics of newsletters, how he grew it, how, how he acquires customers, how he's monetizing all that stuff. Well, you caught my eye because you always tag me and I'm thankful that you tagged me in posts because you're starting to kind of change your philosophy from just being a newsletter to, to can I launch businesses off of the audience that I've created off of this local newsletter in Winnipeg? Is that right?


Jas (Winnipeg Digest) (00:43.682)
Yeah.

Yeah, yeah, that's about the gist of it. would say just as a little difference as we have, so it's 106,000 people audience. About 72 is social media and then about 35 is our news.


Nikolas Hulewsky (01:14.478)
Okay, was that always the plan with the newsletters? Like, hey, let's launch a local newsletter and then build a business on top of the distribution.

Yeah, I mean, we've always wanted a portfolio of companies, like that's kind of what I want in the ideal world, obviously much easier said than done. But then this is kind of the first of it. creating content, so on and so forth. So we do all of that. In return, they're going to do five markets this summer. They already did four. Our fifth one is this weekend. you
